image.altText: Ben Carroll talking to the government.

props.synopsis: The federal government has offered to lift its funding share for public schools, but Victoria has rejected the offer in a situation the state's education minister has described as "difficult".

title.children: Victoria rejects federal school funding deal and demands more from 'rivers of GST gold'

image.altText: Police outside a nightclub

props.synopsis: A 31-year-old man has been taken to hospital with life-threatening injuries following an alleged attack at a 24-hour nightclub.

title.children: Police hunt for attackers after alleged stabbing at Melbourne's Revolver Upstairs

image.altText: A chair lift at the bottom of a set of household stairs.

props.synopsis: Older Australians being cared for at home will be able to apply for a new $25,000 palliative support payment when they have three months of life left under the government's aged care overhaul.

title.children: A new $25,000 support payment seeks to make it easier for people to die at home

image.altText: A man creating street art in an alleyway

props.synopsis: With its laneways a hotspot for tourists, Melbourne City Council walks a fine line of encouraging the street art scene while keeping the taggers to a minimum.

title.children: Is it art or is it a crime? These are the rules of street art in Australia's graffiti capital

image.altText: A graphic depicting an American flag that has been torn in half, with a shadow hanging over it.

props.synopsis: Of all the schisms that cleave contemporary America, few are more stark than the divide between those who consider themselves to be victims of US history and those who fear they will be casualties of its future.

title.children: America is on the verge of something fateful, but it cannot escape history

image.altText: A tan, black and white working dog cross and a larger light coloured Husky standing at a glass door looking inside at treats.

props.synopsis: Kyra Duffy now thinks her dogs have been stolen and she's dismayed there's no national pet database to help her.

title.children: 'Pet detective' calls for national microchipping registry to help track missing dogs

image.altText: Sue La Velle

props.synopsis: Photos and a box of ashes are all Sue La Velle has after her son was found dead in a Melbourne home in June. She's sharing her story for the first time in the hope it will prevent others from meeting the same fate.

title.children: A synthetic opioid more potent than fentanyl is spreading across Australia with fatal consequences

image.altText: Jacinta Allan

props.synopsis: Jacinta Allan's first trip abroad as premier couldn't come at a more critical time. As she steps off the plane into Delhi, her mission is clear: mitigate the damage.

title.children: As she flies to India this weekend, Victorian Premier Jacinta Allan's mission is clear

image.altText: A Sudanese refugee stands in front of rows of people sitting on the ground in Chad.

props.synopsis: Death, displacement, famine, and the collapse of most government and public infrastructure -- that's been the experience of the ongoing civil war in Sudan.

title.children: With 10 million displaced, some call it the forgotten war. These numbers explain the conflict in Sudan

image.altText: arms export AAP Joel Carrett

props.synopsis: The main organisers of Wednesday's protest outside the Melbourne Exhibition and Convention Centre were Students for Palestine and anti-war group Disrupt Land Forces.

title.children: Protesters injured by foam bullets and 'excessive force' in Land Forces protests weigh up legal action

image.altText: A birds eye view of the river coming down

props.synopsis: The mesmerising transformation of parched sand giving way to the rush of fresh, flowing water has people across a vast outback region in awe as it carves a path from the bush to the sea.

title.children: After weeks of relentless rain, this once-dry riverbed begins to brim with life-giving water

image.altText: A woman in tears sits next to a young girl.

props.synopsis: A series of mass evictions has uprooted entire communities in the Pacific Island nation as people move to its urban fringes — and the government is looking for answers.

title.children: 'My heart was in pain': Vanuatu's mass evictions are leaving families in limbo

image.altText: A Brisbane Lions AFL player is seen surrounded by GWS players, with a defender's arms wrapped around him.

props.synopsis: Dual Brownlow medallist Lachie Neale had his foot in a moonboot after Brisbane's stunning AFL semi-final comeback win over GWS, but he is expected to be fit to play in the prelim against Geelong.

title.children: Moonboot and a prelim: Neale backed to tackle Cats after Lions' stunning finals win

image.altText: Ostrich looking at camera; a close up head shot.

props.synopsis: Animals can sleep on the wing, standing up, sitting in a tree or diving in the ocean. Many don't close their eyes, and some don't even have eyelids. Here are some of the strangest ways to snooze.

title.children: Is this ostrich awake or asleep? The sleeping habits of many animals may surprise you

image.altText: A woman wearing red sunglasses

props.synopsis: A spokesperson for the New South Wales Electoral Commission says it expected to officially declare the results from October 1 to 3, with the timing varying between councils.

title.children: Voters will have to wait until next month to find out results of the NSW council elections

image.altText: A redheaded man with a beard

props.synopsis: As Harry turns 40, he has not only transitioned from the cheeky spare into a husband and father, he has increasingly aligned himself with Diana's family over the House of Windsor.

title.children: Harry at 40: Why the prince is now firmly aligned with Diana's wealthy family of rebels

image.altText: A young teen with braces, a wide-brimmed hat and agriculture show ribbons on her shoulders smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: Amy Ballinger hates to think of the consequences if the persecution she suffered had followed her home. As her own children start school she wants them banned from social media until they're 16.

title.children: Bullies made school hell for Amy. Now she's a mum backing a new social media age limit

image.altText: A blurred photo of trucks and a motorhome driving on the Bruce Highway

props.synopsis: "The Bruce" is being labelled a national disgrace, pock-marked with dangerous potholes and signposted with memorials to people who have died on the notorious road.

title.children: The national highway that some drivers say is more like a 'goat track' — with deadly consequences

image.altText: An illustration of a well-dressed 18th century man with words in the background

props.synopsis: Colonial Australian John Lang lived a life of dramatic highs and lows, and he may have been the first Australian novelist. He is celebrated in India, but still largely unknown on our shores.

title.children: This writer with convict heritage could be Australia's first novelist. Why haven't you heard of him?

image.altText: Couple in 1980s wedding attire signs registry

props.synopsis: Kelly Delaney only learnt the full extent of her husband's lies and deceit after his body was found in Victorian bushland.

title.children: Mum bares all about life married to a compulsive gambler

image.altText: A Black woman in street clothes instructs young dancers in ballet outfits

props.synopsis: Ballet dancer Michaela Mabinty DePrince, who was raised in an orphanage in war-torn Sierra Leone, is being remembered as "a beautiful person, a wonderful dancer".

title.children: Ballerina Michaela Mabinty DePrince, who grew up in a Sierra Leone orphanage, dies aged 29

image.altText: Reuben Cotter of the Cowboys celebrates with teammates after scoring a try

props.synopsis: North Queensland have found ways to win their past four games in Sydney and the Cowboys say they won't be daunted by another journey in the knockout final against Cronulla.

title.children: Early to bed ... Cowboys' secret to Sydney winning run as they keep finals hopes alive

image.altText: Back of man praying with hands up.

props.synopsis: In 2008, journalist Adriana Carranca was living in Kabul when she heard about a local pizza shop run by fellow Brazilians. The owners were on a secret mission, but not the type she expected.

title.children: This couple risked death to run a pizza shop in Afghanistan. It was a front for their secret mission

image.altText: A middle-aged man with short grey hair, dressed in a dark suit, stands amid journalists outside a court.

props.synopsis: The court of Criminal Appeal has told the ABC the bus driver has lodged a notice of intention to appeal the 32-year jail term he received over the crash that killed 10 people.

title.children: Brett Button begins appeal process after being jailed over Hunter Valley wedding bus crash

image.altText: An adult in blue scrubs treats a young African child with marks on their body.

props.synopsis: The World Health Organization says it has cleared Bavarian Nordic's mpox vaccine, the first such vaccine to be approved by the agency for containing the spread of the disease in badly hit African countries.

title.children: World Health Organization approves first vaccine against mpox, clearing the way for developing countries

image.altText: A close-up image of Lex Marinos

props.synopsis: Former Double J presenter and Kingswood Country star Lex Marinos has died surrounded by friends and family at his Sydney home on Friday "at a moment of his choosing", his family has announced.

title.children: Actor, director and radio presenter Lex Marinos dies aged 75

image.altText: Two boys hold fishing rods and smile at the camera next to a lake.

props.synopsis: The woman, 42, was released from hospital today and taken to Parramatta Police Station where she was charged.

title.children: Mother charged with DV-related murder over the deaths of her two sons in Blue Mountains

image.altText: Two Richmond AFLW players embrace as they celebrate a goal.

props.synopsis: Richmond posts consecutive victories after a five-goal opening term lays the platform for a 46-point defeat of Sydney, while Fremantle and Carlton also win in week three of the AFLW season.

title.children: Tigers romp to massive AFLW win over Swans as Dockers' late comeback sinks Power

image.altText: A man on a boat looking at mussels

props.synopsis: Mussels, long regarded as little better than fish bait, are now sold as a gourmet delicacy — and veteran fisherman Lance Wiffen says farming them sustainably is also helping the environment.

title.children: From fish bait to fine dining — now mussel farming is cleaning up Port Phillip Bay

image.altText: A thoroughly destroyed light aircraft lying in a paddock.

props.synopsis: A witness has described trying to come to the aid of a man who died in a light plane crash in central Victoria.

title.children: Pilot dies in central Victorian light plane crash

image.altText: Laura Loomer in focus in the foreground; Donald Trump blurred in the background.

props.synopsis: Laura Loomer joined US presidential candidate Donald Trump's campaign trial this week, attending his presidential debate against Kamala Harris and joining him for a 9/11 memorial service.

title.children: Who is Laura Loomer, the far-right activist Republicans fear is influencing Donald Trump with 'garbage' tactics?

image.altText: portrait shot of Kerry Wynn-Taylor in her loungeroom

props.synopsis: A 'ticking time bomb' was unleashed inside this retired school teacher's body when she was exposed to asbestos. Now she's joining the fight to make the removal of the deadly material safe and affordable to all.

title.children: 'It's insidious': Retired teacher with mesothelioma joins urgent push to dispose of millions of tonnes of asbestos

image.altText: Rodney Croome arrested in 1988

props.synopsis: A nation-first financial redress scheme has passed Tasmania's parliament for people convicted under past laws against homosexuality and cross-dressing.

title.children: 'It's only just': Tasmania's new laws to allow victims of 'cross-dressing' compensation for past convictions

image.altText: Ken Hinkley and James Sicily exchanged words after the siren

props.synopsis: Hawthorn captain James Sicily defends his behaviour following a heated exchange with Port Adelaide coach Ken Hinkley in the wake of Friday night's AFL semifinal.

title.children: 'I don't regret it': Sicily stands firm after Hinkley confrontation as AFL issues 'please explain' to Power coach

image.altText: Three young men, one Black and two white, sit on chairs in blue and yellow shirts speaking to each other

props.synopsis: Citizens of the US, UK, Belgium and France have been convicted of participating in a coup attempt against the Congolese government in May this year.

title.children: Six foreigners sentenced to death in Democratic Republic of Congo
